data.title: Prince Of Persia Sands Of Time Remake Set for 2026 After Prolonged Development Journey
meta_keywords: Prince of Persia Sands of Time Remake
The Rogue Prince of Persia update
data.meta_description: The first delay for Prince of Persia occurred in December 2020 shortly after its initial announcement, followed by an indefinite delay in February 2021.
data.text:
Ubisoft has revealed the anticipated release window for the Prince of Persia Sands of Time Remake, slated for 2026. The announcement was made during the Ubisoft Forward 2024 event, accompanied by a brief teaser video. The remake has faced substantial development challenges, including delays and shifts between studios. Initially planned for an earlier release, the project experienced setbacks that necessitated changes in development teams and a shift to Ubisoft Montreal in 2022.

ALSO READ: GST Council To Discuss Amendment Easing Tax Burden On Online Gaming Sector On June 22: What We Know So Far

Prince Of Persia Sands Of Time Remake: The Trail Of Delays

In November of last year, Ubisoft announced that the project at Ubisoft Montreal had achieved a significant internal milestone and was advancing steadily.

The first delay for Prince of Persia occurred in December 2020 shortly after its initial announcement, followed by an indefinite delay in February 2021. A major development shift occurred in May 2022, when Ubisoft transferred the project from Ubisoft Pune and Ubisoft Mumbai to Ubisoft Montreal. Since then, development has been ongoing at the Assassin’s Creed Valhalla studio, and by May 2023, Ubisoft confirmed the project had entered the "conception" phase of progress.

ALSO READ: Steam Sees Remarkable Growth in India: How The Platform Gained Over 150% Users in Just 5 Years

The original Sands of Time, a beloved title from 2003 available on PlayStation 2, GameCube, Xbox, and PC, garnered critical acclaim and commercial success. Ubisoft has been working on this remake for over four years, and it has now entered full production with support from co-developing studios in Toronto, Bucharest, Paris, and Pune.

ALSO READ: Valorant Gets Brand-New Map Called Abyss With An Exciting ‘Twist’; Know All The Details Here

In related news, Ubisoft revealed upcoming enhancements for Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown, set to receive a story DLC in September, and The Rogue Prince of Persia, which released its first significant free update on June 10.
